headline: Roasted Okra
description: Looking for great okra recipes? Try this roasting technique: It's easy and very tasty, and as a bonus the texture is firm and toothsome, not gummy.

video.description: See how to make a tasty alternative to fried or stewed okra.
video.name: Roasted Okra

name: Roasted Okra
recipeIngredient: 18 fresh okra pods, sliced 1/3 inch thick
2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste
2 teaspoons black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Arrange okra slices in a single layer on a foil-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast in the preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Easy and simple. How do you get any better than that?
This was very good. Baked it in cast iron pan. Used "everything" seasoning rather than other seasonings.
I didn’t put nearly the amount of salt. I sprinkled it with nature’s seasoning and I like it cooked longer so probably 25 minutes to make it crunchy/chewy

I know when cooking any okra, except fried. You need to add a cut up tomato or some white vinegar, to cut the slime Something acid. Like when you smother okra in a cast iron skillet you need to add a tomato or a little white vinegar . I made this and tossed the okra, oil, and a little vinegar in a bowl, before cooking. It was good and crispy..

Wow! Easy-Peasy! I used a bag of pre-chopped, frozen okra. Did not thaw them. Tossed them in a bowl with olive oil, kosher salt, pepper and a sprinkle of pepper flakes. Roasted them for 40 minutes. They were PERFECT!!!! Thank you!
Fantastic simple recipe. Fabulous. I used up air fryer instead of oven. Worked great.
Tastes great!!!
Wow! Everything I love about okra without the extra carbohydrates from cornmeal or bread crumbs. Yay!!!
The ease of making this is right up my alley. Only thing I’d change…reduce the salt!

As written, this recipe is 100% inedible! 2 tsp of salt and pepper is WAAAAAAAAAYYYYYY TOO MUCH for 18 okra pods. I’ll try it again with maybe ¼ tsp of each. Terrible waste of a batch of okra. I would have spotted this error had I been the one actually preparing the meal, however, I just sent it to my daughter, a less experienced cook, as something new to try. Should have paid more attention.

Way too much salt. I used a bag of frozen chopped okra that I thawed in running water in a colander. Only used 1 tsp of kosher salt and it was still way too salty. Took a lot longer than the recipe stated. I got tired of waiting after 40 minutes so I took it out. Probably won't make again.
This was really good, much better than I expected. I didn’t expect it to be so light and crunchy. Definitely the best okra I have had!

Being from Oklahoma, I grew up on Fried okra but these days I don’t eat fried foods so I wanted to TRY this recipe to see how I liked it! Turns out I LOVED IT. I did roast it 20 minutes because I wanted it crunchy (like fried). I tossed it in a bowl with EVOO and the salt and pepper first and the. Put it on a foil lined cookie sheet. YUM! I’ll go back for MORE okra before the season is over!

This roasted okra was wonderful! I enjoy okra any way, in gumbo, sautéed with tomatoes, fried! I purchased some fresh okra from the farmers market over the weekend and oven roasted it per the recipe. I did cut the pods lengthwise. The flavor was terrific.

Amazingggg loved it! I'm pakistani and the way we make okra at home is more of a curry kinda thing. Okra has been my least favourite vegetable but dude this recipe was fabulous! Loved the crunch plus it was so easy to prepare! Tastes so much like corn
One of the best ways to eat okra. Delicious snack.
I have been making this recipe for about 3 years now!! I love these okra! I do not use that much salt! For me, that is way too much. Otherwise, love, love, love these!
Roasted Okra by ncope. Four cups okra per recipe. Roasted, but friedtasting, 30 mins.
Oh this is soooo good! I put a little shredded Parmesan on it while it was hot...thought I might eat the whole bowl myself!!!!
Delicious and not slimy at all. So easy to make. I preferred the thinner slices for texture.
Super easy and worked beautifully!
What a great way to enjoy okra! Loved this! The heat removes any sliminess and provides a slight crisp. Will make whenever I can find fresh okra!

Excellent option for really tasty okra. Split the smaller ones 3 strips larger and placed in a mixing bowl.. Lined baking sheet with foil. Mixed olive oil, black pepper, Sriracha salt, old bay, minced garlic, onion flakes in a small bowl and spooned over okra and turned over gently. Spread on foil and sprinkled with grated Parmesan cheese. Cooked about 25 min till lightly brown and okra starts to get a lil’ wrinkly like my skin. Turned off the oven and let it stand in hot oven while pan frying ham steak. Served with black eyed peas. Okra was very zesty, firm, not slimy and definitely a keeper. This recipe can be altered a bazillion ways . No picture; got lost in the moment.
Soooo good! I put a thick slice of onion in to roast along with it as another reviewer suggested. Should have stirred halfway through but it was still amazing
Loved it. The only thing I did different was to put the okra with the salt, pepper, and olive oil in a bowl first and mix it thoroughly before spreading onto the baking dish.
delish, I added a little creole seasoning and some goya seasonal to take it up a notch

Delicious!!! Easy and fast. The okra was so yummy, I ate it as a veggie side, but could see doing this and making a tangy dip to go with as a snack/appetizer at a party, an alternative to potatoe chips. YUM! Thanks. PS - I did 1/2 my batch with just salt, pepper and garlic powder, and the other half with a garam masala spice mix, both were yummy.
Easy, fast, delicious!!! I added some Italian seasoning like I usually do with zucchini. Perfecto!!! Try this!
First time having okra and this was delicious! Will definitely make this again using various spice blends. Easy, tasty & quick side dish!

This roasted fresh okra dish is excellent! Though I roast vegetables often, roasting fresh okra is new to me, so I cannot stress enough how great it came out! I cut the okra as directed, but put it in a bowl and tossed it gently with the olive oil and S&P and then spread it on the foil-lined sheet pan. Outstanding!
My husband loved it, I added some Parmesan about 5 minutes before it was done.

Any easy reference for roasting Okra, but two full teaspoons of salt for three servings is incredibly high. A few shakes from the salt and pepper shakers after roasting was plenty. Probably no more than a 1/4 to 1/2 tsp. Can substitute almost any spice for the salt/pepper. I frequently use a cajun-style seasoning on mine.

Wonderful! Nice alternative to fried okra which is a staple here in the south. I have made this many times, the first several I followed exactly. Turned out fantastic. Since I have experimented and found it work well with larger pieces up to 1/2 inch. Works best with large okra. Never cook okra if it’s hard and woody, but the more tender large ones work well at 1/3”. Smaller okra including the very small most tender work at 1/2”
Or a little more. 

I have also experimented with the seasoning. A little salt and some Cajun seasoning like Tony’s (Cacheres) is our favorite. Season salt was good but we enjoyed a little heat from the Tony’s. Tony’s is good on everything!

You also have to experiment with your oven and temp. Mine seems to come out better closer to the element and at 450° rather than 435°. 

Good recipe.
One word... AMAZING! I’m so happy to find this tasty way to eat okra! It is so simple.

We loved this!! Well...other than it’s WAY too much pepper! And we like pepper! I’m thinking 2 tsp has to be an error. But other than that it’s tasty and a WONDERFUL alternative to fried okra!! Thank you for sharing!!
It was ok. Nothing to write home about. The flavor was a little plain, so next time I might experiment with different seasonings (at least garlic powder). I was pleased that it wasn't slimy.
Best recipe ever!!
I cut down salt & pepper in half & it’s till salty. Everything else is good
I made this exactly as offered and wouldn't change a thing. Delish!
I thought this was a good way to cook Okra. Nothing fancy, but it's a fast, easy vegetable side dish
So simple and so yummy. My husband (who has always claimed to hate okra) had seconds!
Cooked it about 5 minutes longer. Overall it was quick and easy.
It wasn't as crunchy as I thought it would come out to be, but it definitely wasn't slimey. Best fresh out of the oven! Will definitely make again!

Since i cook for myself now at 72, a diabetic. I buy plain frozen okra. This recipes is fantastic .. Low- Carb. 
Thank you for sharing.
So good! I tossed them with olive oil, salt and garlic powder and baked them until they had a little crisp.

Umm Yumm! This was soo simple and delicious! I added a bit of red pepper, which made it quite spicy too me. My husband LOVED it. I put my sheet pan in oven on the bottom shelf to pre heat along with the oven, then toss them in the seasoning and oil in a bowl and throw them on the hot pan. Sizzle! I'm not sure if this works with foil. I just prefer to use less. Easy, healthy and, not slimy at all! We will be eating more okra. Thank you to the poster!

This is the first time I've cooked with fresh okra. I was very happy with the result. I added a pint of grapes tomatoes, they browned and were nice and bursted. I served for a New Year's Day meal with sausage gumbo, cornbread and coleslaw.

I want to sure about this recipe, only ever eating okra breaded and fried.. (it's a southern thing)... anyway... this is definitely a keeper, thanks for giving me a different way to prepare okra and healthier.

By far the best way to enjoy okra
We have made it many times since it is okra is in season, so. Tasty without any breading
Easy and tasty. I would recommend.
This is excellent! I cut the recipe in half and baked it in my toaster oven. Quick, easy, and very tasty.
Awesome!! We has never really eaten okra except in gumbo, so this was wonderful. We enjoyed it so much, I will definitely make it again. It was delicious and so easy!! My kinda recipe!!

Nope. Not for me. Cannot compare to fried. I don't fry my okra in a deep fryer and I don't use a wet batter. I cut in circles into a colander, wash, then sift salt and pepper and stone ground corn meal through the okra in the colander. Makes a bit of a mess in the sink, but makes the okra lightly battered, not that heavy mess like frozen okra. Then I fry a level spread of the okra in a half inch of hot oil inside a heavy skillet. Nothing else comes close to the delicious crispy texture of okra done this way.

I am 75 yrs. old, cook for only myself. This is my first review. Check out the “nutrition” breakdown below the recipe. Wow. Now I have a snack I don’t feel bad about. Of course, I ate all I had (so much for servings). Just a note, the okra I bought was soooo fresh, pods about 3-4 inch long, a big, heaping handful. I rinsed, cut into 1/2 inch pieces, put all in a zip-lock bag, then did the oil, salt, pepper thing (saved a mess). Tossed them up to evenly coat. Did the aluminum foil on the baking pan (mess saver). I only cooked mine for 16 min. Wasn’t crispy, so could have probably cooked 2 minutes more or so. Even though soft but cooked, flavor was awesome. Take it easy on the salt. NOT SLIMY. Definitely going to run out and buy some more. Totally enjoyable. Thank you ncope for a great recipe.
I loved it !!!!
The slime is the best part of okra. But my family is from Arkansas. This is delicious!
I drizzled avocado is and ground some pepper over the okra, then roasted it on the gas grill. It was definitely the best way I have prepared okra yet. Thanks for the idea.

I made this tonight for the first time after a neighbor shared some okra from their garden. It was very tasty! The smaller okra pods came out very tender, but the larger ones were tough and stringy. Lesson learned! Would definitely make this again, or add to other roasted veggies.
Amazing! Best way to cook okra. Made it so simple by keeping them whole. Baked for 15 minutes.
Love okra! I used frozen chopped okra and it was yummy.

We LOVE okra. It's a summer staple in my kitchen. For this recipe, I used the okra I had - closer to 30 pods than 18. I tossed them in the olive oil and sprinkled on 1 tsp. of pepper. The recipe calls for 2 tsp. Even the 1 tsp. is too much. Next time, I will start with about 1/4 tsp. pepper and a higher temperature so that they crisp up a little better. This is merely the beginning!
This was exactly what I hoped for! The oven roasted okra satisfied my craving for fried okra without the trouble and calories.

I thought this was really good and easy and I didn't think slimy at all. I used Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning for part of the salt and really didn't measure it or the pepper. As one reviewer stated, this is somewhat like fried okra, but with less calories and carbs. My new favorite way to cook okra!

YUM YUM YUM We love fried okra, but not the fat and calories.
My daughter and daughter-in-law are doing "lo carb" so this is perfect for both. It is so good. Did not change a thing except made twice as much, thank goodness, as it was devoured on the WAY to the table! Thanks for a great one that will be enjoyed often at our house.
Sooo Easy!! and Sooo GOOOD!! I really loved them!!
Super easy but so good!!!
simple and delicious
Made no changes, other than placing all ingredients in a gallon-sized slider bag and ensuring uniform covering of each okra bite. "Roasted" 15 minutes. Absolutely delicious, easy to prepare.
So easy to prepare and wonderful to eat
I tried this recipe as a way to get my veggie servings for my nutrisystem diet. Quite delicious! I added mushrooms, brocolli, and cherry tomatoes as well. Thanks for sharing!

Absolutely fabulous way to prepare okra. Make sure your okra is young and not longer than 3 or 3.5 inches in length. Make sure you slice them exactly half an inch to 3/4 of an inch... any bigger and they are not roasted properly. I increased my roasting time to 30 minutes and roasted them at 430°. I used a very little bit of cayenne pepper to give it an extra sassy kick! Next time I plan to add a tablespoon of lemon juice pre cook. Oh, and I put the oil, salt and pepper in a gallon ziplock to evenly coat. I didn't use foil but Pam on cookie sheet and they came out great. Definitely a fabulous recipe
Great just the way it is. Much healthier than fried okra.
This recipe was really great! I used chorizo instead of the regular sausage and left out the red sauce. It was amazing!! If you try this just make sure you cook the chorizo (if raw) beforehand.

WOW, was this ever fabulous! 

With one VERY BIG caveat: if I had followed the recipe, it would have been MASSIVELY over-salted and over-peppered. 

I had 30 pods and since it was a new recipe, I didn't want to risk them all so instead of 18 pods, I used half of what I had: 15, but that's only ~10% less than the recipe. I couldn't imagine TWO teaspoons of salt & pepper on that small amount of food, so I slashed it over HALF (1 scant tsp) and it was still WAAAAAY too salty (and I *love* salt), although the pepper had a nice bite at 1 tsp. so I'll leave that. 

But on the next one, I'm using 1/2 tsp. of salt. Yikes. 

BUT, with that said: this recipe is now my very favorite way of eating okra. More than battered & fried, more than gumbo, and more than stewed with tomatoes! It's amazing.

The reviews are right. I've made this 3 times now and the only problem I have, I can never make enough. The only way I liked to eat okra, in the past, was fried. This is oven fried okra without the hassle of adding the coating. Thank you for sharing this recipe with us.

What a delicious way to use okra. Since I found this recipe this summer, this is the only way I have cooked okra. Only thing I do different is use Cajun seasoning on them instead of salt and pepper. Thank you soooooo much for an easy recipe that is so good!!!!

Yummy! Might like this better than traditional fried okra, and so easy to fix. I added 8 cherry tomatoes cut in half plus stirred in 1/4 cup Panko bread crumbs after reading several other recipes. Delicious.
This has become my favorite side dish/snack for the summer.
Loved it!!!!!! Thank you.

This was so easy and delicious. Even my husband loved it! I followed another reviewer's advice and soaked the okra in water and lime juice for 15-20 minutes before slicing. The okra wasn't slimy at all.
My kids gobbled this up! Even my 6 year old who eats almost 0 veggies.

First time I made it exactly as written. Delightful! Second and third time I spiced it up a bit. A little red pepper gives it a little kick. Experimented a time or two but the original recipe is what the grandkids want. They like it "extra crispy" so I leave it in a little longer for them.

I used two bags of frozen cut okra. I tossed the okra with the oil and seasonings in a bowl before putting on the baking sheet. I cut the salt and pepper a bit and added garlic powder and a few flakes of red pepper. I roasted about 25 minutes and the okra was still tender but the slime was gone. This was easy and a winner for my crew.

A sweet elderly woman gave me a bag of okra... a vegetable I have done well to avoid most of my life. I made this recipe, adding a splash of Balsamic Vinegar, and found a palatable way to eat okra. With enough of the added ingredients, it almost tasted like roasted asparagus.
Wow! Delicious!!

Cut back on salt after reading the reviews. I added a little garlic and a bit of red pepper for kicks. Very good. I will use this again.

I also soaked the okra in 10-minutes in lemon juice because I didn't have lime. The okra wasn't slimey.
Just ok...wasn't impressive compared to other roasted veggies, which I LOVE...so I was expected theses to be awesome based on reviews.
This is a winner. Add other veggies to it to make it a more hearty side.

I really love okra and was looking for a different way to make it. This seemed like it would be really good. I followed the recipe exactly and I just didn't like it at all. The texture was off..too chewy, not crispy enough on the outside & once they sat for just a few minutes, they were just flat, mushy & oily. I really wanted to like this, but it was actually a big letdown & a waste of fresh-from-the-garden okra.
First time I made okra, definetely not the last, I love this receipe, very tasty. If roasted enough, won't be slimy
This was so easy and very good. I added whole cherry tomatoes, wow!

I made it spicy adding coriander, cumin, paprika and chili powder. I've never enjoyed stewed okra and am trying to avoid carbs. Roasting seamed like a great option. This recipe turned out great the way I made it.

I'm not a huge fan of okra. I like it fried but that's about it. I gave this recipe a try since we have so much okra from our garden. Surprisingly good! The okra came out nice and crunchy, not slimy at all. I added a little garlic powder with the salt and pepper and it was delicious. I am excited to try adding other spices next time. You could add a little cayenne to make it spicy or cumin and chili powder.
it was the best okra i've ever had. i made the receipt as printed but the woman at the farmers market said sometimes she adds parmesen cheese.
Really easy and delicious. Gets rid of okra's sliminess while developing its flavor.
Loved this recipe, wasn't slimy at all and very tasty.
Added granulated garlic -- cooked a little longer than suggested. We sometimes add mini-eggplants (cut to about the same size)

Needing a way to use okra from the garden, my husband went looking for new recipes. He found this one while I was out of town and tried it. He was raised on fried okra, and thought this was just as tasty. He told me about it when I returned home. I was skeptical. . . He made some tonight and WOW! Kind-of like fried okra meets roasted asparagus. The only thing he did differently was to cut the okra into 1" pieces. Move over gumbo and pickled okra! We have a new favorite for the weirdest of all veggies!
Oh my gosh!!! This was delish!! Followed the directions exactly. Thank you so much for the recipe :-)
